intro: Elwendia alata, commonly known as the winged elwendia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late summer. Elwendia alata thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
